purpleculture_pinyin:
biàn
a braid or queue; to plait
коса или очередь; плести
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 辫)
Pictophonetic: 辛 indicates the sound; 糸 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿲ Left to middle and right
    • 辛 [ xīn ] bitter; toilsome, laborious; 8th heavenly stem
    • 糸 [ mì ] silk; thread
    • 辛 [ xīn ] bitter; toilsome, laborious; 8th heavenly stem
heisig_chinese_memo: Silk spidey braids together two chili peppers to add to the presentation of his Mexican food he made for Mary Jane.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The chili pepper beef noodle shop is next to the hair dresser so Spidey likes to get his hair braided and then go for lunch.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "糸" to "辡" sound. The original meaning is interweaving. "Shuowen": "Braids, Jiaoya. Congshi, Yinsheng." Such as "Wenxuan. Zhang Pingzi's "Si Xuan Fu": "Braid Zhenliang thinks that she is stunned, and miscellaneous skills think of hungry." Tang Dynasty Li Bai "To Wang Liyang after Xuezui": "If you have a body, don't commit flying dragon scales, if you have hands, don't braid fierce tiger beards. ."

" Braid " also means braids. Such as "New Tang Book. "Tian Gui Dao Zhuan": "Captures carry benefits and have accumulated years, regretting entering the dynasty today, untie the braids and cut gussets, we should wait for the heavenly order." Qing Dynasty Cao Xueqin's "A Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 21: "If you don't wear a crown at home, you don't always have a role. I only braided the short hair around it into small braids, put it on the top of the hair, braided a big braid, and knotted the red tape."
humanum_short_description_en: From "糸", "辡" sound. The original meaning is interweaving.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「辡」聲。本義是交織。《說文》：「辮，交也。从糸，辡聲。」如《文選．張平子〈思玄賦〉》：「辮貞亮以為鞶兮，雜伎藝以為珩。」唐代李白〈對雪醉後贈王歷陽〉：「有身莫犯飛龍鱗，有手莫辮猛虎鬚。」

　　「辮」也表示髮辮。如《新唐書．田歸道傳》：「虜背惠且積年，今悔過入朝，解辮削衽，宜待天旨。」清代曹雪芹《紅樓夢》第21回：「在家不戴冠，並不總角，只將四圍短髮編成小辮，往頂心髮上歸了總，編一根大辮，紅縧結住。」

Chinese: Silk spidey braids together two chili peppers to add to the presentation of his Mexican food he made for Mary Jane.
Meaning: braid
Hanzi: 辫
Story: The chili pepper beef noodle shop is next to the hair dresser so Spidey likes to get his hair braided and then go for lunch.
Kind: traditional

從「 糸 」，「 辡 」聲。本義是交織。《說文》：「辮，交也。从糸，辡聲。」如《文選．張平子〈思玄賦〉》：「辮貞亮以為鞶兮，雜伎藝以為珩。」唐代李白〈對雪醉後贈王歷陽〉：「有身莫犯飛龍鱗，有手莫辮猛虎鬚。」 「 辮 」也表示髮辮。如《新唐書．田歸道傳》：「虜背惠且積年，今悔過入朝，解辮削衽，宜待天旨。」清代曹雪芹《紅樓夢》第21回：「在家不戴冠，並不總角，只將四圍短髮編成小辮，往頂心髮上歸了總，編一根大辮，紅縧結住。」

Tang Dynasty Li Bai "To Wang Liyang after Xuezui": "If you have a body, don't commit flying dragon scales, if you have hands, don't braid fierce tiger beards. ." " Braid" also means braids. Such as "New Tang Book. "Tian Gui Dao Zhuan": "Captures carry benefits and have accumulated years, regretting entering the dynasty today, untie the braids and cut gussets, we should wait for the heavenly order." 辮字的基本解释

辮
biàn
见“辫”。

辮字的汉语字典释义

[①]［biàn］
［《廣韻》薄泫切，上銑，並。］
“辫1”的繁体字。“編2”的被通假字。
(1)交织；编结。
(2)把头发分股交叉编结成的条条儿。
(3)像辫子一样的东西。
(4)犹串。

辮字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　辮； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1252第13
【廣韻】薄泫切【集韻】婢典切【韻會】平免切【正韻】婢免切，?音辨。【說文】交也。【增韻】繆也。與編通。詳編字註。

【廣韻】簿泫切【集韻】婢典切【正韻】婢免切，?音扁。【說文】交織也。【增韻】繆也。【張衡·思?賦】辮貞亮以爲鞶兮，雜技藝以爲珩。　【集韻】从糸。【正韻】亦作編。
辮字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

暂无。
